abstract: Frontier Communications, based in Stamford, Conn., will be taking over the Verizon assets in an all-stock deal, the companies said.
snippet: Frontier Communications, based in Stamford, Conn., will be taking over the Verizon assets in an all-stock deal, the companies said.
lead_paragraph: Verizon Communications on Wednesday took another step away from its century-old heritage as a company that provides telephone service over copper wires. It agreed to sell divisions that offer service to 4.8 million phone lines in 14 states to Frontier Communications for $3.3 billion in cash and $5.2 billion in Frontier stock.

headline.print_headline: Verizon Sells Phone Lines In 14 States To Frontier
